Sri Mulyani Akan Investigasi Desa Siluman Penerima Dana Rp 1 M
05 Nov 2019, 02:18 by Dias Prasongko, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengatakan dirinya bakal melakukan investigasi mengenai adanyan laporan desa tak berpenduduk, namun mendapat kucuran dana desa sebesar Rp 1 miliar. Dia mengatakan mendengar kabar ini usai mengikuti rapat perdana kabinet.
"Kami mendengarnya sesudah pembentukan kabinet dan nanti akan kami investigasi," kata Sri Mulyani usai mengikuti rapat kerja dengan Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat (DPR) di Kompleks Parlemen, Senayan, Senin 4 November 2019.
Sebelumnya dalam rapat kerja bersama dengan Komisi Keuangan DPR, Sri Mulyani mengungkapan adanya laporan terkait desa fiktif tersebut. Dia mengatakan desa tersebut mendapat jatah dana desa namun nyatanya tak berpenduduk.
Desa yang fiktif tersebut bisa muncul diduga sebagai modus supaya bisa mendapat bagian dan memanfaatkan dana desa. Menurut Sri Mulyani, ini bisa muncul sejalan tugas ajek pemerintah yang hanya menyalurkan dana desa ke kepada desa tanpa peninjauan lebih ketat.
Menurut Sri Mulyani, desa fiktif tersebut dilakukan dengan cara mengusulkan pengajuan dana desa, namun desa tersebut baru dibuat belakangan. Karena itu, dirinya akan melakukan inventarisasi desa-desa bersama dengan Menteri Dalam Negeri untuk mencegah hal ini berlanjut.
Mantan Direktur Bank Dunia ini menjelaskan, dirinya juga akan mencari tahu mekanisme seperti apa dalam hal terbentuknya sebuah desa. Termasuk melakukan identifikasi siapa pihak terkait yang bisa melakukan hal itu.
"Kami tentu akan lihat seluruh prosedurnya supaya jangan sampai ada statemen, yang kwmudian menimbulkan persoalan, terkait berapa jumlah desanya, lokasinya di mana dan bagaimana transfernya," tutur Sri Mulyani.

Sri Mulyani Will Investigate Siluman Village Recipient of IDR 1 Billion Funds
05 Nov 2019, 02:18 by Dias Prasongko, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati said she would investigate an report on villages with no inhabitants, but received a village fund of Rp 1 billion. He said that he heard this news after attending the inaugural cabinet meeting.
"We heard after the formation of the cabinet and we will investigate later," Sri Mulyani said after attending a working meeting with the House of Representatives (DPR) in the Parliament Complex, Senayan, Monday, November 4, 2019.
Previously in a joint working meeting with the DPR Finance Commission, Sri Mulyani revealed a report related to the fictitious village. He said the village was allocated village funds but in fact it was not populated.
The fictitious village could emerge as a mode of being able to get a share and utilize village funds. According to Sri Mulyani, this could emerge in line with the task of the government subject to only channeling village funds to the village without a closer look.
According to Sri Mulyani, the fictitious village was carried out by proposing proposals for village funds, but the village was only created later. Therefore, he will conduct an inventory of villages together with the Minister of the Interior to prevent this from continuing.
The former Director of the World Bank explained that he would also find out what kind of mechanism in terms of the formation of a village. Including identifying who related parties can do that.
"We will certainly look at all the procedures so that there is no statement, which then creates problems, related to how many villages there are, where they are located and how they are transferred," Sri Mulyani said.
